Journal Story: Hoping that weather holds out for both sunny and clear. Worried that Alberto may reach this far north by 1 June, my start date.
Checking forecasts. Will slack pack first three days and pick up full pack after crossing I70 in Maryland June 3.
One more day of work until I leave. Weighed pack today ... 31 lbs without food. Charlies Pack is clean and ready to go. Hope weather holds out for a couple of days.
Leaving for Harpers Ferry and Start Point. Will leave Harpers Ferry around noon.
Got washed out in MD and Charlie is sick. Switching to Section Hiking in VA for next several weeks until ready to continue North Bound again.
Hiked northbound  stopping at Bearfence Shelter. Spring was running but had to be scooped. Charlie and  my first night in tent.  Guess who wanted the air mattress?

Grandson and I walk the trail together today. He eat a Cheeseburger and fries at Big Meadows. Both of us had Black Berry Ice Cream. Phyllis, Megan and Alex joined us for lunch. New Family saying coined by Alex "Family Tradition".
Dry walk for the first half, more water on the lower section. Last mile was quiet and spectacular stands of trees. Hope when we reached the road.
Mild weather, Charlie and I headed up and up then down. Good view of Wintergreen. Ended in the rain under a sigh
Nice Day. Saw first rattlesnake of trip. Not the sound I thought it would be. Lucky Charlie was behind me. Gave space and it was gone in several minutes. Meet first SOBO AT Thru hiker today.
Start location: Humpback Gap to Rock Fish Gap via Paul Wolfe Shelter

Journal Story: Pretty day, warm, took the long way to do a short piece of the trail.

Started at 10:45 but encountered heavy rain, lightning and thunder.  Stopped at 3 PM because of new round of storms. Had a good view from Stonyman Mt. Met southbound named Compass who was short on supplies, gave him what I had, hope he gets more.
Hot and steamy Evening Hike. Charlie enjoyed the stream.
Good walk but still wet from rain. Had dinner at Devils Backbone Brewery. Phyllis and I enjoyed our dinner. Charly was worn ou
Saw last four SOBOs ended to Skyland for the night.. Good Luck to them. Saw over twenty today even though weather started in the high 20s/low 30s.
Tried Hiking in SNP but it was closed. Moved North on Trail hoping to hike from Dicks Dome to Rte 50). .
